txt.en: 'Come on, let's get off this hill. I feel like people can see us for miles around!'
You have found the stone marker
The Ranger Culang has learned of a great treasure buried long ago by a DÃºnadan-landholder and wants it recovered before it is found by tomb-robbers.

The inscription on this stone marker is barely legible, but these words can just be made out:

  \qTo settle disputes, men fight in the ring of stone.
   Outside the wall, my marker lies hidden.\q

This new riddle may reveal the true location of the treasure.

The treasure may lie beneath another stone marker, somewhere in Evendim, if this riddle is to be believed:

  \qTo settle disputes, men fight in the ring of stone.
   Outside the wall, my marker lies hidden.\q

You should examine the marker when you find it for some clue to the location of the treasure.
'I think I can make out some words here.'

The stone marker is surrounded by signs of digging; if it once marked the location of the treasure, it has surely been found.\n\nThe marker bears an inscription, all but worn away by the passage of time.
'You think this is some kind of riddle, maybe?'

The inscription on this stone marker is barely legible, but these words can just be made out:

  \qTo settle disputes, men fight in the ring of stone.
   Outside the wall, my marker lies hidden.\q

This new riddle may reveal the true location of the treasure.

'Another riddle? How did it go?

  \qTo settle disputes, men fight in the ring of stone.
   Outside the wall, my marker lies hidden.\q

'I do not know for certain, but these words may be speaking of the arena in Ost Forod, to the north-east of Tinnudir, among the hills of Tyrn Fornech.'
Find the solution to the riddle
'Ah, this is a waste of time.'
